reorder.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to order a product to be supplied again
reorder.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Could you reorder more of this fabric?
reorder.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to change the way that things are ordered or arranged
reorder.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to order more of a product, usually because there is none left
reorder.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Buyers in the clothing trade are reordering the most popular items heavily.
The video rental company initially ordered 80,000 copies, but reordered three times to keep pace with demand.
